intro: Psephellus manakyanii, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia and Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
